name: 2,4-dichlorobenzyl alcohol
Reason: 2,4-dichlorobenzyl alcohol has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components: (1) The basic unit, benzene, has a melting point of 5.5 °C. (2) The two chlorine atoms increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and dipole-dipole interactions, estimated at around +20 °C each. (3) The alcohol group introduces a hydroxyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +10 °C.
